p: Routine preoperative examinations were performed to take venous blood to test blood calcium and parathyroid hormone and retest in the morning the next day after surgery. Serum calcium lower than 2.2 mmol/L or parathyroid hormone lower than 7 pg/ml is defined as transient hypoparathyroidism after surgery, and oral calcium supplements and vitamin D3 are given. Re-testing of the parathyroid hormone at 6 months after surgery is still <7 pg/ml.
